column4: guys if the gvfsd-metadata prolonged 100% CPU usage is still present after upgrading to 10.04, that would be me or it's still an issue?
check what you have starting on startup
anything specific to look for?
and thanks for the reply by the way :-)
I had the same issue and it was a laptop app and it was on my desktop
it ran 1 core up to 100%
I am supposing there might be something using it on startup that shouldnt be
well, it kept switching between the cores 100% each for some period of time then somehow stop, I remember reading that it was an issue with the number of files within a certain directory
So I simply moved the rubbish from the Desktop to a subdir, gvfsd-metadata started to behave and be nice to the cores
I am not sure about that but I had the same issue however it was another app using it on start up and I couldnt kill it so I had to install boot manager and kill the apps until I found it
aha then my advice might be useless =/
but still whenever I try to move something files around CPU usage rises
did you try the forum?
for sure, my guess was that the forum was where I found the number of files note
sounds like we had different issues sorry I couldnt help...
actually I'll check startup as well ...
ok
No on the contrary thanks for replying :-)
I used boot manager so I could kill them at the time I removed them so I could watch the cpu
I wish you luck

with 9.10 I tried to replace Nautilus with pcmanfm it was very light weight, that was when I could kill nautilus now I'm unable to even kill nautilus and gvfsd-metadata, that got me interested to figure out why is that behaviour is present in the first place
but anyway ... :-) good luck for you too
Oh do you think it might be "user folders update"?
